lines.gurmukhi: nK isK lau sgl AMg rom rom kir kwit kwit isKn ky crn pr vwrIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Nakh Sikh Lau Sagal Ang Rom Rom Kari , Kaati Kaati Sikhan Kay Charan Par Vaareeai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: If I cut every part of my body from nails to the top of my head into the size of a hair and sacrifice them over the holy feet of the Sikhs of Guru'

lines.gurmukhi: Agin jlwie Puin pIsn pIswie qwNih lY aufy pvn huie Aink pRkwrIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Agani Jalaai Dhouni Peesan Peesaai Taanhi , Lai Uday Pavan Hui Anik Prakaareeai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: And then these cut parts are burnt in fire, ground to ashes in a mill-stone and these ashes are blown all over by the wind;

lines.gurmukhi: jq kq isK pg DrY gur pMQ pRwq qwhU qwhU mwrg mY Bsm kY fwrIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Jat Kat Sikh Pag Dharai Gur Pand Praata , Taahoo Taahoo Maarag Mai Bhasam Kai Daareeai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Spread these ashes of my body on the paths leading to the door of the True Guru, that the Sikhs of the Guru take at the ambrosial hour;

lines.gurmukhi: iqh pd pwdk crn ilv lwgI rhY dXw kY dXwl moih piqq auDwrIAY ]672]
lines.transliteration_english: Tih Pad Paadak Charan Liv Laagee Rahai , Dayaa Kai Dayaal Mohi Patit Udhaareeai ?672?

Shabad OS B.translation: So that the touch of the feet of the Sikhs treading that path may keep me engrossed in the remembrance of my Lord. I may then pray before these Gursikhs to take meÂ·-the sinner across the worldly ocean.  (672)
